wn8DDb64n1fgyovg9EN46A.text: Delicious pizzas, fast service, don't have anything to complain about! My favorite is the pizza with four types of cheese. I like how the different tastes are mixed, nice combination.

eo4LpLYymRnIheO4GU_cog.text: Another great place to go. But do book early. ESP on Fridays n Saturdays. As this place is always packed. Great ice-cream there too

GffCb6OfkGqxlS5XQMPhFA.text: Authentic italian dishes, amazing, friendly staff who always greet you with a smile and an incredibly warm welcome - I can't recommend this place strongly enough! We moved to Harringay a couple of years ago and stumbled across the restaurant on Stroud Green Road just by chance, but I'm so glad we did. The first time we went it was just me and my boyfriend, but after receiving such attentive and efficient service (sorry to hear the guy's experience with his daughter's 9th birthday party - I don''t have children and have never taken children to the restaurant so my experience will obviously be somewhat different to yours, but all I can say is the staff are such good fun and usually embrace birthday parties so enthusiastically - they must've been having a very rare off day.) we've been back many times with different friends and my parents and the restaurant caters perfectly for all. The clay oven and area where the chefs make traditional italian pizzas is mesmerizing to watch and the end result is delicious! Portions are on the large size, but staff are more than happy to provide a doggy bag to take home leftovers (nothing nicer than cold pizza for lunch the next day!) so there's no waste. The atmosphere is buzzy, friendly and pretty fast, but having been just with my partner and then in groups, it suits everyone. The staff again are great at identifying a perfect table and ensuring your every need is catered for. This is one of my favourite restaurants because of the tremendous quality of food and amazing atmosphere. I feel so lucky we have this on our door stop, but if you're not local, do pay Pappagone's a visit - you won't be disappointed (erm, unless you maybe have a large party of under 9s??!)

RZR1WOF-GJbhPC8Es0Es3Q.text: We love this place, it is the absolute best. S & S

ir3wTyYzpPK9US6KIL4thA.text: -mazin'. Save your time cutting out pizza express vouchers and try this place for better food and a bit of character (check out the business cards...) Generous portions and great calzone.

5b_8U2qSj27aw4BclH5bAw.text: Had a friends birthday here. There was near 20 of us and we were very well looked after. Food was mega good and staff were understanding to dietary requirements . I left half trollied with a smile on my face.

uJSpaYm15XAuFUHHaCxI6A.text: If you want a real pizza in London, this is the place to go. Stone-oven baked pizzas with the best, authentic topics make for a mouthwatering dish.Wine is good and the prices are very reasonable. Authentic food and service, the owner is incredibly nice and it is fun to watch the pizzas being made.Try it!

EwjZ8qCXXXO_bbfUS1JGgA.text: Excellent italian food for one of the busiest place on Stroud Green Road. Friendly service and great atmosphere.

Qjz9fo8Bo_AJ1yshBqkEMQ.text: By far, one of the best italian restaurants in london! Lovely margeheretta pizza alongside garlic bread, delicious deserts as well! Absolutely love this place. D

rY1VeG_l_ne-EeGHoUYchA.text: The best sea food risotto I've tried in a long time The prices are ok.no delivery which is a bit of a headache If you love ice cream you must try there's..amaze balls!!!!

Eoip8ohUUeXh19q8W7YFfg.text: Discovered this place recently and was really impressed with the quality and prices of this pizzeria. We ordered a take away for a whole party of people and all the pizzas arrived quickly and were hot and tasty! Haven't eaten in the restaurant yet but am looking forward to trying it out.

rTgYdUZM4ijpzPkiKZZiKw.text: Best pizzeria in London , have goone there for over 12 years !!!

Ljn4IUnfdjMs5oWyVAAJ5g.text: Absolutely love this place. Firstly, it's the atmosphere of the place, as mentioned elsewhere there is always a birthday or other celebration going on here, and the staff are fantastic, friendly and helpful. They have a lovely range of pasta & pizza dishes, and the prices are excellent value. I take my daughter here at least once a week, and she loves the Carbonara and the pizza garlic bread. You do get very large portions, so if you're going for a lunchtime, it's worth asking for a smaller portion, otherwise afternoon work tends to be a little less productive!If I there is one thing I'd like them to improve, it's the wine list. It's pretty non-existent, and could do with a little more work, but everything else is grand

Ft6iT0sNou4xbaFIw6WUbQ.text: Pizzeria Pappagone is where you go when you have missed your Italian friend's home cooking. It is clean, the staff are extremely friendly at the ambiance is electric. Above all, the prices are very reasonable! You have not tasted Italian food if you have not tried Pizeria Pappagone!

kWHen3_fi5zeoax1JEiZVg.text: Great real Italian pizzas here for a very good price. Can eat here for under a tenner. Great boisterous Italian atmosphere with the waiters creating lots of noise. Good to come with a group of friends. Has been pretty busy every time we have been, sometimes with a queue at the door, though we have not had to wait long for a table. There is takeaway sevice available if you prefer not to wait. I would recommend this restaurant to groups and to smaller parties.

a8MNYvGdCMe9_uMcyUauUA.text: Pizzeria Pappagone, in fact bar pizzeria Pappagone was founded in 1998 by Marco, an Italian bloke who is still seen on place most evenings. This is a party place, I do not remember a time when there was not a birthday or some celebration going on and staf seem to really enjoy making noise, signing and some time even dancing around. Food is good, and it is not expensive and they have a large selection of dishes, not only Pizzas although I only tried their pizzas. Servings are large and with most pizzas priced around 6 pounds, this is surely a place I recommend both for a party of people and even a date, as long as you do not mind some noise and happiness around you.

VPdYP0Rnode8Z_HhsrHxeQ.text: After moving to the finsbury park area recently I was really looking forward to eating at pappagone tonight. Unfortunately I have just returned to my flat feeling sick and sorry... As a vegetarian I expect that when I order a pizza vegeteriana I get a pizza devoid of any meat toppings. As I was tucking into my pizza vegetariana tonight I noticed a big pink topping (half eaten) on my slice. I turn, shocked, to my carnivourous other half and ask him what he thinks that suspicious pink topping is. He wrenches it off my slice and tells me in no uncertain way that it is the same ham featured on his pizza capriciosa! At this point I start feeling very unwell and manage to dig around in my, to my eyes, now inedible pizza to uncover some more meaty looking scraps! Oh joy. I havent had to accidently consume meat since various cultural and linguistical misunderstandings led me to eat a meat pastry in northern Brazil 2 years ago. After rejecting an offer of a different dish we didnt have to pay for our meal at all but I really wanted to love this place - being just around the corrner from my new pad but, alas, I am now sitting at home, awaiting a shop-bought pizza from my oven, swishing the physical and physcological taste of meat out of my mouth with copious amounts of cheap red wine!

QJu-WsBBVota2LSYZ-MUaQ.text: Pizza. Did you hear me? PIZZA! Now. At a start of what turned out to be a very boozy night I had an epiphany: I needed Pizza to survive this. So before hitting the bars we decided to line our stomachs at this lovely Italian restaurant near Finsbury Park. We have been here before and have always been happy. What is there not to like: Yummy pizza served by yummy Italian waiters! They greet you like they know you and haven't seen you in a while and they are charming and friendly. Sadly that night we were surrounded by screaming children and decided to retreat to tables near the bar, so we could actually hear ourselves. Otherwise a very nice eating experience with a huge pizza for me and black squid spaghetti for my friend. Great food all around.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Pappagone - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pizzeria Pappagone - London, United Kingdom

M8RUXUQa9W9PkhZcdr2Rkw.text: A massive menu absolutely full of winners. It's well priced and always busy/full in the evenings so book if you can, but once you're say down the service is pretty fast.They have a good selection of pasta and seafood but I'd recommend the deep fried mozzarella balls to start and then any pizza is good. Enjoy!

YUp3ToOyEFBu3lohrfCiWw.text: Best pizzeria in London with great portion sizes and family atmosphere. Delicious bruschetta!! Great gelato - sometimes get it from hole in wall as a late night treat

McApVLcNrrGr39WkJ0hblA.text: I have been to this establishment several times and I continue to go back as the food is so easy and tasty. The sangria is definately a drink to have while you wait for your table. This place gets very busy but is well worth the wait for a cheap, wholesome meal.

0zQ6r-GuxUWG7OHbbGVM3g.text: This place is busy and VERY LOUD. WILL NOT BE BACK EXTREMELY RUDE SERVER NAMED "Massamu" Fighting back with a paying customer and not apologizing for his own mistakes on taking down the wrong order and especially having the audacity to tell me I can't get a glass of ice with my water because I ordered tap water instead of bottled still... I would tell nobody to come back to this terrible place. I made a mistake not telling the manager how my experience that night was but here is my review so everyone can see what type of restaurant they are running here.

N5XOxlsKeS_qE8O8WZUj2g.text: Might not look anything fancy from the outside but this place is always busy because it does such amazing food and has great service. One of the best places to eat in / around finsbury park and crouch hill.

5nakw38QkQqkrKTd9u7ePA.text: As an extreme meat lover (bordering on obsession), it surely says a lot when I would go for the vegetarian option! The parmigiana is absolutely divine, probably the best in London! The aubergine slices are delicately fried and coated with a loving layer of crispiness that's enough to drive my carnivorous instincts away!

4dDFuIaLeEOeqysPIO0fkw.text: Good, bustling, reliable Italian or pizza. It's conveniently located, as well. I don't really have a lot bad to say about it, but it gets only four stars because the largeness of it makes the ambiance suffer a bit. It was pretty noisy, too. But the food is solidly good. Not the best Italian, but for the price and the amount of food you get, it's definitely a neighborhood staple.

ic-bhqVSa28pfDlDpjysRQ.text: Aw Pappagone's! Our old neighborhood pizza place. They have delicious pizza which you can watch them make from their wood-burning oven. Pastas, starters and salads are also always good. Great local restaurant, always busy for good reason they have good pizza, good prices and good atmosphere. It's always someone's birthday at Pappagone's and if it's not you should tell them it is so they can play their Italian birthday song. La Porcetta which is a bit further down Stroud Green road is always only half full because Pappagone's is so popular.

CNt93avnElEfBkCWjeuMng.text: I used to be a regular customer at Pappagone when I lived in North London. Being Italian, I love my pastas and pizzas, and you can definetely find great Italian food here! Prices are more than reasonable and portions are huge! Most of the time I have to ask for a doggy-bag to take my leftovers home.The atmosphere is also very nice and friendly. Make sure to book on weekends, or you might have to wait a long time for a table.

yAd3bwo89WPxF5OzPqZIgg.text: not a bad place for a Pizza and drink  haven't tried the other dishes on offer but they sound great. I think that Franco Manca have got to have taken the prize for Pizza in London but this place is very close to their quality though not quite as good  sorry Pappagone fans!It tends to be busy most nights  but its got a real nice buzz and the food is tasty..so give it a whirl you won't be disappointed

oqHfIEcIVHvhMAmIi9QmfA.text: This place is just the best!! The owners and staff of Pizzeria Pappagone have absolutely mastered the art of the family restaurant. I have never recieved anything but the warmest of welcomes, truly sincere and consistent every time. The food is very well priced and tastes delicious. I really think these guys just dont DO a bad dish. I can't recommend this place enough. Its as comfortable being a couple oout for a meal or for a family of 10. A brilliant place and one of my favourite restaurants anywhere in the world! GO as soon as your feet can carry you. You will not be disappointed.Here's last nights incredible lasagne instagr.am/p/MNpk7wO6p_

RhcEyCb1c-OWbHdAA3R8dw.text: They totally know me here!  Well...at the very least they make me feel like they do, which is a good feeling!  If you're cool with it, they'll always welcome you into the restaurant with a shake of the hand. It certainly makes you look good in front of your guests (even more if you act suave) so this has become my choice-restaurant when I have visitors to tend to.But It's not just the "who-you-know" factor that warrants me taking my friends there, its the food itself.  Great menu with good options that describes every meal, amazing portions, with stellar ingredients and taste that either proudly reminds you of one's Italian roots (like me!) or leaves you wishing your surname ended with a vowel too!Multiple times I have had to bring the meal home with me so I still haven't had the gelato or puddings, but what I do know is that from the welcome handshake to your late-night's or next morning's cold pizza, you've made the right choice!

YRtvM-9cWJchQpR2EsGdEw.text: From the outside, looking in, this place doesn't look like it's going to offer much in the way of great quality food, but looks can be deceiving.Upon first impressions, this seems like a real family restaurant. The staff recognise a few in our party straight away and are welcoming and jovial. The night we went, there were 15 of us. We made a reservation, were seated immediately and once we'd ordered, the starters came within 15 minutes, which was not bad at all.The thing I noticed the most about the food here was just how big the portions were! There's nothing worse when you don't get what you pay for but Pappagone is not scrimping on portions at all.Once our pizza had come, I was surprised at just how huge it was and had to share with a friend. The food was hearty and really tasty. All the pizzas are cooked in a wood-fired oven.My favourite thing about this place was their selection of tasty Italian ice-creams. I cannot begin to tell you how great the chocolate hazelnut ice cream was and you can ask to have a little taster of each flavour first.I'd definitely recommend going back if you want to celebrate a birthday or just take a bunch of friends, this is the perfect, relaxed sociable atmosphere for the start of a big night out.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Pappagone - London, United Kingdom. Stuffed at Pappagone's!

RFHvnQaS1imDFid4KZSIRg.text: Italian food at its best! I often go here with the same group of people every couple of months on a Sunday afternoon always leaving full to the brim and ever so slightly tipsy from the complimentary (times 4) grappa!The pizzas, pastas and calzones are out of this world! You can add any toppings you want. The ingredients are fresh and the food is all made with such love.The staff top this place off! They are Italian and passionate and friendly about their restaurant and food, always cracking jokes and so good with children.Calamari fritti con zucchini is my favourite starter, absolutely tasty and not too filling so enough room for your main! Choosing a pizza is always difficult - last time I went for the Calzone alla Partenopea - definitely recommend with extra chilli. Just superb!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Pappagone - London, United Kingdom

c_0DcOWymHQqQPwTv2_qYA.text: I visited this place for an end of work project party courtesy of employers. Tired, cold, and coming down with a virus I wasn't sure if I was really in the mood. Needless to say I ended up loving it! It definitely lived up to it's motto of 'It's a nice place to stuff your face'. Even on a Sunday it was pretty busy. Our party of twenty was escorted to the back where they'd moved together smaller tables to make one long one. It definitely meant a need for co-operation if anyone wanted to go to the loo! But it was reasonably comfy once you'd found your place. Wine was quickly served (and very nice). We had a bit of a wait before the pizzas and pastas started arriving, but when they did it was in style. Suddenly waiters were zipping up and down with bulging plates, trying to locate who'd ordered what. A couple of people who'd arrived late did have a bit more of a wait before their food came, but most of the group was served within minutes, and they only had to wait about fifteen minutes more. Not bad with a group of twenty I think. The latecomers actually finished their food before I finished mine. Pizzas are made in a traditional oven near the front of the restaurant. Pasta appears from a (visible) kitchen at the back. My pizza was lovely. Crispy, slightly irregular base, rich cheese, creamy spinach and ricotta, flavoursome sun dried tomatoes. My only problem with it was it was a little rich, and I had to resort to a ginger beer to keep my tummy settled! Actually there seemed to be a little bit of a problem and a wait before my drink appeared, and I suspect they may have sent out for it. Top points for that if so. Everybody's food looked lovely and fresh, and some swapping took place! On a budget of about £10 per head we all had a main and wine, and left with stuffed stomachs and in a happy mood. Definitely recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Pappagone - London, United Kingdom

ZnGuVEjP12XnOyOAnJvoEA.text: A very famous pizzeria in the Finsbury Park area, always very busy, with an incredibly noisy and warm staff. They have a very wide bar floor, where you can watch football on the big screen, choose between a selection of cocktails, and also order and eat your pizza. Pizza is the reason to go there, but especially if you have something to celebrate, like a birthday, tell to a member of staff, and they will bring you a surprise-pudding... It lost its flair during the years, now the place has become a busy money-machine, but it's still worth a go for a night in good company.

4crcvn9qFVn1AJ0qYTXCqQ.text: Have you been in the area, or do you live there and haven't yet gone to Pappagone? Well, check your pulse because you may actually be dead.It's an awesome place, full of great Italian vibe and the food is fantastico! I have taken a few of my Italian friends there and they were rally impressed so that's telling. The waiters and chefs are all Italian and super friendly. The pizzas are yummy and not too expensive at all. Even though it's a pizzeria, you can find bigger selection of Italian cousine there. The place can get pretty crowded on the weekends but definitely worth a visit. There is a little bar there too and you can watch footie on the screen too while enjoying the sound of vuvuzelas.

awx_DV4R_P6CO3MaFjbozg.text: Excellent pasta. Friendly, authentic staff. Book in advance.

ERbf6cMglJdlgmAVYxYGmw.text: When you're a Pappagone you're a Pappagone for life.From your very first crust to your very last limoncello shot.Welcome to A Stroud Green Story, where the two gangs of Pappagones and Porchettas fight it out for Finsbury Park pizza and pasta dominance.Me, I nailed my colours to Pappagone some time ago. Sure, I flirted with Porchetta next door for a while, but they lost me the day my sister poured sugar all over her pizza after mistaking it for grated parmesan. Pappagone would never trick one of my family like that, no matter how dim she is. No, Pappagone's look after you... "Hey, you're a regular... have some free limoncello!" The atmosphere is always fun, which goes someway to explaining the usual queue to get a table. Both Pappagone's and Porchetta next door are big, loud and do a range of luscious thin crust stone-baked Italian pizzas and big slurpy pasta dishes. It's weird that two of the best pizzas in England are side-by-side in Finsbury Park. Is it the air? Porchetta have gone on to become a chain around town, but Pappagone's remains original with that great Italian family feeling. That's why I've joined their gang. I love eating here.

gaxj13IOLHGmK4VG-LMW0g.text: Great pizza, great atmosphere!I LOVE this place, and you should never doubt a crowded restaurant even at 9pm on a Saturday night, living nearby I have been here several times, sometimes a little inebriated (ok lots of times) but occasionally not. Normally I just stick to the pizzas, but this time I went the full 3 courses. We had the Bocconcini Fritti (deep fried Buffalo Mozzarella in a tomato sauce) who doesn't like deep fried cheese and we also had Burratina Pugliese more mozzarella and aubergines, WINNER! I stuck to pizza Parmigiana for the main, always good, I love the variety of vegetarian options and pizzas they have available. I had sticky toffee pudding for dessert (which is the best dessert ever), although I definitely want to try the Gelato they are so well known when I go back.Service in there is always pleasant, yes you may have a wait for a table but they are happy for you to stand at the bar and take your name down, so no annoying queuing. Despite it being epically busy we were served quickly, the waitress was happy, helpful and being next to the open kitchen gave us the chance to thank the kitchen staff personally.I honestly cannot say enough good things about this place, they are also on Deliveroo (so you can now get takeout delivered from them), I have a feeling Pizzeria Pappagone may be seeing the most of my paycheck.

tla0B3f-Iycq6VV22VnOfQ.text: I've had the pizza here before and that was great. This time we tried the pasta, that wasn't so good. The pasta a little underdone, beyond al dente. The carbonara that my friend had tasty but so greasy it left him feeling queasy at the pool of oil staring back at him after he finished. My aubergine, tomato & mozzarella sauce was better. And the place is super noisy even at 3pm on a Saturday afternoon, little kids and day drinkers. Some people like that liveliness, but we didn't like shouting just so we can hear each other

AlHS3ISGjIizFhxqcUVAmA.text: There is so much competition in London for Italian food that it's difficult to even judge who serves the best pizza, pasta or mains. Pappagone has always been a popular destination for diners, it's food has always been excellent, the staff are always friendly and prices are affordable. The restaurant has an a cafe style outside where you can sit and enjoy the sun and the crowds walking past. The interior is well decorated and has a family friendly feel. I couldn't help but order the pizza and an ice cold beer. The pizza was good though the toppings could have been spread out more evenly. I was really after something spicy but didn't want pepperoni... Unfortunately I couldn't see any diavolo so had to go with the chilli oil which was the real stuff. The tirrimisu was home made and large enough for the two of us. Pappagone is a great place to meet with friends and family. Id be happy to have this as my local any day.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Pappagone - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pizzeria Pappagone - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pizzeria Pappagone - London, United Kingdom

DWe7Jhmyt51oKEOgAnreDA.text: Nothing bad to say about this place only good, The restaurant was packed but yet the service was still very quick, The food comes up fast and hot, everything is extremely fresh and tasty, it was my first time here and I wasn't disappointed, I will be definitely going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Pappagone - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pizzeria Pappagone - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pizzeria Pappagone - London, United Kingdom

osH9tO8GGq74BaWrBmdGhA.text: This is probably my favorite italian place in London! A bit noise..but this makes it more Italian..

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Pappagone - London, United Kingdom. Pizza
Photo of Pizzeria Pappagone - London, United Kingdom. Beautiful perfect pizza
Photo of Pizzeria Pappagone - London, United Kingdom. Antipasto pappagone

cgyGcqUQSCw56G_P5U1UYA.text: Delicious pizzas and lovely staff. Decent serving sizes (just right - not huge and not small). Takeaway is fast. Seated service is very busy and crowded with lines at the door during popular times, so keep that in mind!

Ao02Q7tkHgmhA-SOcrh6_w.text: Onto the food. Based On Dan's recommendations we ordered the mozzarella balls which were deep fried and covered in tomato sauce. This was nice and light and the cheese was very gooey. The tomato sauce added an extra kick as there was a slighty spicy taste to it. Good start, thank you Dan.For the main, I went for my tried and tested Calzone, as I wanted to compare it to the calzone at La Porchetta. The filling here was salami, ham, mozzarella and black olives. The pizza was tasty and very filling but didn't have the richness and depth that I'm used to at La Porchetta. However, after the calzone I didn't feel to stuffed and I know that I will definitely be back again and again. Thank you Pappagone for a lovely dinner and see you soon.Read more at lifeofshayan.com/my-blog…

0Pg6-joZz8A2AkYnX88n8g.text: I got the PIZZA PORCINI (no tomato sauce) 9.90Buffalo mozzarella speck, tangy talleggio and fresh porcini mushrooms for takeaway Saturday night.I like the thin pizza slices as it allows the quality ingredients to stick out. I liked the talleggio in particular as its tanginess is appealing and plays well off the porcini mushrooms- although the pizza could use more mushrooms! The bar service was OK- not the warmest but eh, it's London, I expect this.If in the area, the mare e monte looks intriguing.

lxivq9T1qIPJ7SpVG3COqA.text: Pizza was excellent and starters too, I need to come back and try the lasagne, it looked so good on other people's tables!!

75sbk0K6YfeDUt2Nl83mlw.text: I had heard a lot of good things about this place and was intruiged enough to walk right up the Stroud Green Road after an Arsenal game and bring my mates in tow one evening.It was packed and looked a lively atmosphere. The staff was rushed off feet it seems but told us to come in and was fine to wait around by bar area (bit squashed to wait there though) but good intentions.We eventually got a table for 4 in about 30 mins later with our beers still in tow. Now I did enjoy the ambiance but I can't help feel on this one visit that the pizza were slightly overrated. I feel pizza have to have some subtle differences (Franco Manca crust for example) in order for them to stand out. Here it didn't really, and I found the crust on my ham, artichoke and egg pizza a bit soggy. Was almost too thin for my liking (which probably caused this). Was nice and fresh but just didn't really do anything for me to make it memorable.As I say I did really like the vibe and being so close to my football team I am definitely willing to come again and try and another one for an updated review.

Yj__aJWFD3I_MS7OlQRmsA.text: What do you know. I've finally found a good pizzeria in London.I often complain about waiting staff being rude and slow but there's no complaining here. The staff are super friendly and cheerful, which gives this place a lovely atmosphere. Though it can get too noisy at times.I had the Quattro Stagioni, which was delicious. And ended with a banoffee pie. Will definitely be back again.

ztcK7gqSjKEj0o8ZrLIhuA.text: The food was delicious & the customer service was even better! The women working was clearly out numbered, but she never broke a smile & was very attentive.

TM4I-_Y1fUSyWYRGOVChJw.text: What a wonderful gem in the gritty streets of Finsbury Park/Stroud Green....this place is sooo worth giving a try if you are in the mood for comfort food.This is your ultimate neighbourhood Italian restaurant: staff seems to be exclusively Italian (at least they all behave that way), they are super-friendly, and the place is always darn packed with locals. Seriously, try to get a table for four on a weekend evening and you're probably in for quite a wait...but this wait is well worth spending.The food is solid in all instances...it's not epicurian heaven, but all the dishes that we sampled (pastas, pizzas, starters) were tasted fantastic and the whole buzz around you contributed to your party having a good time as well. (Having said that, I would probably not go here on a romantic date, nor alone...that might just be a little bit too depressing! ;-)Nevertheless...try out this local gem!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Pappagone - London, United Kingdom. Banoffe Pie
Photo of Pizzeria Pappagone - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Pizzeria Pappagone - London, United Kingdom. Lamb

O8ec5aT02D0sH4Bvi_CB6Q.text: If you wanna try real italian food with excellent taste and genuine italian atmosphere this is in Pappagone.Best pizza ever had in London in 4 years.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Pappagone - London, United Kingdom. Italian sangria from Pappagone

_wjnbXXQbyGqx8EzbhBr6g.text: Someone says it is the best pizza in London, so I have travelled this far to try it. The place is actually very big and the menu quite long. I tried the "parmigiana" pizza as it was suggested to me by the Italian Farmers bartender..it is indeed quite good, with buffalo mozzarella and fried aubergines!The service is okay, considering I was there on a friday night and the place was really crowded. Not bad at all and quite cheap, but I am not sure it is the best pizza in town.

GnsPl_PMg892prnYRHmbeg.text: This place is awesome. Mega busy, you have to book. We didn't and ended up having a drink outside for an hour, but it was well worth it. Proper wood fired pizza, brilliant pasta and even a gluten free option. Best Italian I've had in ages! Great Italian food made by Italians :0)

9YMh1ugs4VZbXt9G745wQw.text: Without doubt my favourite Italian restaurant in London.Staff are always friendly and are Italian so create a really authentic atmosphere in the restaurant which is simple without being tacky. Diners are a nice mix of Italians and Londoners which also contributes to a buzzing vibe.The food is incredible especially the pizzas which are made in an authentic pizza oven that sits in the middle of the restaurant allowing guests to see the food being made. Yet to be able to finish a pizza but they are happy to box up left overs so you can take home. The pasta and anti-pasta dishes are also great quality and everything is very reasonably priced.If I could change one thing it would be a slightly bigger wine list.If you are in the area you have got to eat here!

jAyabYk3_L0ZN8jviIEZNw.text: Seemingly the most popular eatery in finsbury park. Its not bad, but I am genuinely confused by how popular this place is versus the various other nearby options. Food and drink are reasonably priced but nothing spectacular by any means. Interior is quite cool and i appreciate the football vibe. Just my opinion but I feel overall this place is still over-scored. Goes to show there is room in finsbury park for new competition.

WFfdxu7zFFEEZEV8juKSWA.text: Birthday parties here are really great, everyone gets plenty to eat and the food quality is good too. The staff make any occasion seem effortless and they sing "Happy Birthday" to boot. Just take yourself there to try it out.

kDZQXbPmt2yjt2PTJM82OQ.text: Best Italian food in Finsbury Park! We always get pizza here and they do a huge amount of Italian dishes. They also do amazing ice cream.
